pr_title: Issue #5018 - cancellation of WebSocketClient.connect Future should fail upgrade

timeline.message:
Issue #5018 - cancellation of WebSocketClient.connect Future should fail upgrade

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #5018 - add testing for WebSocketClient Future cancellations

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

timeline.bodyText: Use just 1 second when you test for false.
timeline.author: sbordet

timeline.bodyText:
Strange comment :)
Why would onOpen() even be called, if the connect() has been canceled?
timeline.author: sbordet

replies.bodyText: I didn't mean that onOpen() should be called, but that onError() should only be called if onOpen() has been called previously. I just wasn't expecting both of them to be notified of the failure, only the future. I will remove the comment.
replies.author: lachlan-roberts

timeline.bodyText: Test also that the nested exception is a CancellationException?
timeline.author: sbordet
sbordet

timeline.bodyText: This is probably going to fail in Jetty 10 since it's an anonymous endPoint and will fail the method handles permissions. Perhaps make it a proper public inner class now to avoid merge conflicts in the future?
timeline.author: sbordet

replies.bodyText: This shouldn't fail in Jetty 10, this CloseTrackingEndpoint extends the WebSocketListener. I think that issue with the public inner class is only for the annotated version as we need to discover the methods.
replies.author: lachlan-roberts

timeline.bodyText:
Please add a test case for the timeout of the future, i.e. calling Future.get(1, SECONDS).
It should not fail the connect() since the semantic is just that of "1 second has passed" when it returns.
The test should then issue a second Future.get() that must succeed.
Also add a test that explicitly fails the future with a CancellationException, which should behave exactly like calling Future.cancel().
timeline.author: sbordet

replies.bodyText:
I wrote the first test case.
For the second one there is no way to fail the future with a specific Exception. Unless we downcast to CompletableFuture<Session>.
replies.author: lachlan-roberts

timeline.message:
changes from review

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

add test for abort with CompletableFuture.completeExceptionally()

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

timeline.bodyText: Should not this be if (throwable != null)?
timeline.author: sbordet

timeline.message:
Test aborting with exception before WS upgrade completes.

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

timeline.bodyText: Don't need this interface, use Consumer<NativeWebSocketConfiguration>
timeline.author: sbordet

timeline.message:
Use Consumer<NativeWebSocketConfiguration> in ConnectFutureTest

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>
